alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 22 at 9:24PM PST until December 24 at 12:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM PST FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Beach flooding associated with King Tides near 7 feet Friday and Saturday mornings. * WHERE...Impacted beaches include Mission Beach, Pacific Beach, Seaside and Cardiff State Beaches, Oceanside Strand, Balboa Peninsula in Newport Beach, and Sunset Beach. * IMPACTS...The King Tides combined with surf of 2 to 4 feet could produce minor flooding of low lying beach parking lots and beach boardwalks. Extreme low tides of negative 1.8 feet each afternoon may also impact boats in harbors and affect navigation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...King Tide times in Southern California this week: Friday 12/23: High tide 7.0 ft at 8:08 AM. Low tide -1.8 ft at 3:33 PM. Saturday 12/24: High tide 7.0 ft at 8:54 AM. Low tide -1.8 ft at 4:20 PM. Sunday 12/25: High tide 6.7 ft at 9:42 AM. Low tide -1.5 ft at 5:08 PM.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions. Be alert for flooding near beaches. Boaters should be extremely cautious navigating near times of low tide, and consider moving your boat to prevent damage due to the potential for beaching.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
